intro: Cranichis micrantha, commonly known as the small-flowered orchid, is a terrestrial orchid native to the eastern United States. It typically grows in moist, wooded habitats and is characterized by its compact stature and delicate, greenish-white flowers. The plant has a rhizomatous root system and produces a single, erect stem bearing several small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are spurred at the base and have a distinctive, narrow lip that is often adorned with intricate patterns. Cranichis micrantha is a rare and endangered species, requiring specific environmental conditions for successful growth and reproduction.
